node.plaintext:
Every nonprofit organization wants a great website, personalized email
addresses, and software to run the organization - and they want it all for free
or cheap.

> This guide will help you, dear nonprofit, to find and configure amazing
solutions for almost $0.
Where we are headed
Nonprofits need amazing technology solutions, but generally nonprofits are not
known for their large budgets or deep technical expertise. Across the board,
nonprofits share two huge common needs:

 1. Technology infrastructure. By infrastructure we mean all the software that
    helps the nonprofit meet their own needs on a day-to-day basis. This
    includes authentication of users, productivity solutions, and more.
 2. Public communication. Every nonprofit needs a website, fundraising
    campaigns, events, volunteer management, and more. In contrast to
    infrastructure (which is typically invisible to or inaccessible by the
    public), public communications are by design available to everyone.

At the end of this journey, we want to arrive at a destination that satisfies
the following criteria, all at a minimal cost. Assume the obvious:
yournonprofit.org should be a relevant name. E.G., ours is ermapta.org.

 * E-mail * Nonprofit staff have @yournonprofit.org email addresses.
    * Shared email addresses, e.g. giving@yournonprofit.org, can be created.
   
   
 * Website * Hosted at www.yournonprofit.org and yournonprofit.org
    * Secured by SSL.
    * 
   
   

Disclaimers
A few disclaimers before we get started:

 * The author of most of this content (Mark Stafford
   [https://www.linkedin.com/in/markdstafford/]) works for Microsoft
   [https://www.microsoft.com/]. 
 * Mark was a volunteer for the Eagle Rock Multi-Age PTA
   [https://www.ermapta.org/] when most of the content was written.
 * The content orients around solutions the ERMA PTA chose to implement. There
   are many other great nonprofit tech solutions available, but they aren't
   documented here.
 * Setup is constantly evolving. These guides may get out of date. If they do,
   please e-mail markstafford@ermapta.org.

An overview of our journey
node.html:
Every nonprofit organization wants a great website, personalized email addresses, and software to run the organization - and they want it all for free or cheap.

This guide will help you, dear nonprofit, to find and configure amazing solutions for almost $0.

Where we are headed

Nonprofits need amazing technology solutions, but generally nonprofits are not known for their large budgets or deep technical expertise. Across the board, nonprofits share two huge common needs:

  1. Technology infrastructure. By infrastructure we mean all the software that helps the nonprofit meet their own needs on a day-to-day basis. This includes authentication of users, productivity solutions, and more.
  2. Public communication. Every nonprofit needs a website, fundraising campaigns, events, volunteer management, and more. In contrast to infrastructure (which is typically invisible to or inaccessible by the public), public communications are by design available to everyone.

At the end of this journey, we want to arrive at a destination that satisfies the following criteria, all at a minimal cost. Assume the obvious: yournonprofit.org should be a relevant name. E.G., ours is ermapta.org.

  • E-mail
    • Nonprofit staff have @yournonprofit.org email addresses.
    • Shared email addresses, e.g. giving@yournonprofit.org, can be created.
  • Website
    • Hosted at www.yournonprofit.org and yournonprofit.org
    • Secured by SSL.

Disclaimers

A few disclaimers before we get started:

  • The author of most of this content (Mark Stafford) works for Microsoft.
  • Mark was a volunteer for the Eagle Rock Multi-Age PTA when most of the content was written.
  • The content orients around solutions the ERMA PTA chose to implement. There are many other great nonprofit tech solutions available, but they aren't documented here.
  • Setup is constantly evolving. These guides may get out of date. If they do, please e-mail markstafford@ermapta.org.
